intro: Hedyotis pulchella var. magnistipula, commonly known as the large-stippled hedyotis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have distinct stipules, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
